member.summary: A transaction type has not yet been specified

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Repository.RepositoryTransactionType.CopyCommit
member.summary: Register the items in the transaction without any updates or propagation

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Repository.RepositoryTransactionType.CommitAsLatestWithLatestChildrenAndPropagateVersions
member.summary: Register the items as the latest versions in the Repository, updating the item version if needed. Update child references to the latest version of the child in the Repository or being committed. Update latest parent items to point to the latest items committed, or the latest updated parents (propagate versions). Propagation is performed within the sets specified, or across the whole repository if no set is specified.

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Repository.RepositoryTransactionType.CommitAsLatestAndPropagateVersions
member.summary: Register the items as the latest versions in the Repository, updating the item version if needed. Update latest parent items to point to the latest items committed, or the latest updated parents (propagate versions). Propagation is performed within the sets specified, or across the whole repository if no set is specified.

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Repository.RepositoryTransactionType.CommitAsLatestWithLatestChildren
member.summary: Register the items submitted as the latest versions, adjust version numbers, update references to child submitted items within submitted items. Update child references to the latest version of the child in the Repository or being committed.

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Repository.RepositoryTransactionType.CommitAsLatest
member.summary: Register the items submitted as the latest versions, adjust version numbers, update references to child submitted items within submitted items.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Utility.Levenshtein
member.summary: Provides a method to computer the Levenshtein distance between two strings.
member.remarks: In information theory and computer science, the Levenshtein distance is a metric for measuring the amount of difference between two sequences (i.e. an edit distance). The term edit distance is often used to refer specifically to Levenshtein distance. The Levenshtein distance between two strings is defined as the minimum number of edits needed to transform one string into the other, with the allowable edit operations being insertion, deletion, or substitution of a single character. It is named after Vladimir Levenshtein, who considered this distance in 1965. Levenshtein distance. (2011, May 11).

member.name: M:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Utility.Levenshtein.Compute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compute the distance between two strings.

The term edit distance is often used to refer specifically to Levenshtein distance. The Levenshtein distance between two strings is defined as the minimum number of edits needed to transform one string into the other, with the allowable edit operations being insertion, deletion, or substitution of a single character. It is named after Vladimir Levenshtein, who considered this distance in 1965. Levenshtein distance. (2011, May 11).
